Title.evidence: Decellularized Dermis Allograft for Venous Leg Ulcers: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults with VLUs ≥3 months and ≥2 cm², with venous incompetence and an ankle-brachial pressure index ≥0.8.

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to receive either DCD allograft plus standard care or standard care alone

Objective.evidence: This trial assessed the effectiveness and safety of decellularized dermis (DCD) allografts as an adjunctive treatment for VLUs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients with a healed index ulcer at 12 weeks.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between October 2019 and October 2022, 71 participants were randomised (36 to intervention, 35 to control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Healing was observed in 5.7% of the intervention group and 15.2% of the control group (OR 0.34, 95% CI 0.03 to 2.31).

Harms.evidence: Five serious adverse events were attributed to DCD application.
